Player History
Had first career hit on 4/3/1985, off Rich Bordi (NYY)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/11/1985, off Bruce Kison (BOS)...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/26/1985, hitting .318 with 3 HR, 9 RBI...
Won World Series with Toronto in 1985...
2/2/1986: Gets a new one-year contract worth $4,071,429 through salary arbitration...
Drove in 9 runs against New York (Y) on 8/27/1986...
Sets a new season AL-Record for HR with 36 on 9/22/1986...
10/6/1986: Signed a contract extension with Toronto, $7,366,944 per year, for 4 years.
Hit 3 homeruns against Texas, driving in 3 runs on 6/26/1987...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/10/1987, hitting .438 with 2 HR, 5 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/4/1987, hitting .370 with 4 HR, 12 RBI...

Won Player of the Week award on 10/2/1987, hitting .350 with 5 HR, 8 RBI...
Won World Series with Toronto in 1987...
Won Most Valuable Player Award in 1987, hitting .283 with 46 HR, 111 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 5/29/1989, hitting .409 with 2 HR, 7 RBI...

Was selected to the 1989 Allstar game...

Won Player of the Week award on 7/24/1989, hitting .407 with 3 HR, 15 RBI...
Was selected to the 1990 Allstar game...
8/19/1990: Signed a contract extension with Toronto, $8,370,000 per year, for 4 years.
Won Player of the Week award on 8/28/1990, hitting .478 with 4 HR, 8 RBI...

Drove in 6 runs against New York (Y) on 9/19/1991...

Won Player of the Week award on 5/1/1992, hitting .400 with 4 HR, 8 RBI...
